title: MCG curator in 'state of shock' at two-day Test
byline: Melbourne Cricket Ground head curator Matthew Page said he was in a ’’state of shock’’ during England’s two-day defeat of Australia in the Boxing Day Test.

title: England End 15-Year Australia Drought with Stunning Boxing Day Test Win
byline: England produced a dramatic Boxing Day Test victory to defeat Australia for the first time on Australian soil in 15 years, successfully chasing down 175 to win by four wickets and avoid an Ashes whitewash.

title: Showers and strong winds forecast across several provinces
byline: The Department of Meteorology has forecast several spells of showers for the Northern, North-central, Eastern, Uva, and Central provinces, as well as the Hambantota district.

title: Delhi’s air quality edges closer to ’severe’ again as smog engulfs capital
byline: The air quality index (AQI) in Delhi-NCR edged closer to the ’severe’ category once again and was hovering around the 391-mark on Sunday morning, with a thin layer of smog engulfing parts of the national capital, according to the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB).

title: Pakistan squad for Sri Lanka series: Babar Azam, Shaheen Afridi miss out; Shadab recalled
byline: Pakistan has recalled all-rounder Shadab Khan for next month’s T20I series in Sri Lanka, but Babar Azam and Shaheen Afridi, who are currently playing in the Big Bash League (BBL) in Australia, have missed out.

title: Sri Lanka Coast Guard rescues 10 tourists from drowning
byline: The Sri Lanka Coast Guard (SLCG) rescued ten local and foreign tourists from drowning during lifesaving operations conducted across several coastal regions from 24th to 27th December 2025.

title: Shadab Khan returns as Pakistan name T20I squad for Sri Lanka series
byline: All-rounder Shadab Khan has returned to the T20I side as the Men’s National Selection Committee named a 15-member squad for the three-match T20I series against Sri Lanka, scheduled to take place later next month. Salman Ali Agha, who featured in a record 34 T20I matches — the most by a Pakistan player in this year will continue to lead the side in the forthcoming series.

title: Ne-Yo apologises to Sri Lankan fans after concert cancellation
byline: International R&B star Ne-Yo has issued an apology to his Sri Lankan fans following the cancellation of his scheduled concert in Colombo.

title: Thailand-Cambodia ceasefire begins after weeks of deadly clashes
byline: A ceasefire between Thailand and Cambodia has come into effect along the border, where almost three weeks of deadly clashes have forced nearly one million people from their homes.

title: We never held party to celebrate CMC budget defeat: Hirunika
byline: Commenting on a video clip that is being circulated on social media where she and others are seen merry making, former MP Hirunika Premachandra said the clip shows a party which was held way back in October this year.

title: Ten foreign women arrested during raid on Kollupitiya spa
byline: Ten foreign women from three countries were arrested during a raid on a premises allegedly operating as a brothel under the guise of an Ayurvedic massage parlour in Kollupitiya.
